 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שִׁטָּה‎</span><sub>27</sub> **noun feminine** ==acacia==, tree and wood (= <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שִׁנְטָה‎</span>\*, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, probably loan-word from Egyptian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***šndt, šond®t***</u></abbr>, [[BDB#Thes|Thes]]<sup>1452</sup> Erman<sup>ZMG xlvi (1892), 120</sup>); — growing in dry places; especially ***acacia (mimosa) Nilotica***; compare [[BDB#Rob|Rob]]<sup>BR ii. 20</sup>, or ***a. seyyâl*** [[BDB#Post|Post]]<sup>Flora 298 f. Hast. DB SHITTAH-TREE</sup> [[BDB#Tristr|Tristr]]<sup>NHB 390 ff.</sup>; — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁ‎</span> singular [[Isa.41.19|Isa 41:19]] (to grow in desert); usually plural, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲצֵי שִׁטִּים‎</span> <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***shi‰‰îm***</u></abbr> (wood), material of ark, altars, staves, etc., in tabernacle, [[Deut.10.3|Deut 10:3]]; [[Exod.25.5|Exod 25:5]]; [[Exod.25.10|Exod 25:10]]; [[Exod.25.13|Exod 25:13]] + 19 t. Ex 25-38 ([[BDB#P|P]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲצֵי‎</span> omitted, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַמּוּדֵי שׁ‎</span> ***pillars of <abbr title="transliteration"><u>shi‰‰îm</u></abbr>*** (wood), [[Exod.26.32|Exod 26:32]]; [[Exod.26.37|Exod 26:37]]; [[Exod.36.36|Exod 36:36]] ([[BDB#P|P]]).
